pull_request.title: Model editor Part 1 - part and joint creation

update.description:
Before compiling, uncomment [gazebo/gui/MainWindow.cc:1086](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/c20a738814b10cb9fe967053677294bbc806e1d9/gazebo/gui/MainWindow.cc?at=model_editor_part1#cl-1086) to enable the model editor.

Part 1:

Features include enabling users to:

- add simple shapes, and import custom meshes as parts (links) to a model

- Add joints to the model

- double click on a hotspot on the joint to configure its properties.

A part inspector for configuring parts will be in the next pull request.
update.title: Model editor Part 1 - part and joint creation

pullrequest.title: Model editor Part 1 - part and joint creation

content.raw:
The items in the Model Editor tab can be selected by the mouse which in turns causes orange highlighting. This doesn't happen with the World tab.

Could you remove highlighting? 

It would also be nice if clicking the `Model Settings` and `Parts and Joints` text would hide/show the contents.
content.html:
The items in the Model Editor tab can be selected by the mouse which in turns causes orange highlighting. This doesn't happen with the World tab.

Could you remove highlighting?

It would also be nice if clicking the Model Settings and Parts and Joints text would hide/show the contents.

content.raw:
code check says:
~~~
[gazebo/gui/model/JointInspector.cc:244] -> [gazebo/gui/model/JointInspector.cc:247]: (performance) Variable 'jointTypeStr' is reassigned a value before the old one has been used.
gazebo/gui/model/ModelData.hh:36:  Blank line at the end of a code block.  Is this needed?  [whitespace/blank_line] [3]
~~~
content.html:
code check says:

[gazebo/gui/model/JointInspector.cc:244] -> [gazebo/gui/model/JointInspector.cc:247]: (performance) Variable 'jointTypeStr' is reassigned a value before the old one has been used.
gazebo/gui/model/ModelData.hh:36:  Blank line at the end of a code block.  Is this needed?  [whitespace/blank_line] [3]
